channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Plants going wild, 1st October
item.description:
Plants going wild and have been left for quite a while. Area used as dumping ground for building materials.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Lion Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large household rubbish by council street bin, 1st October
item.description:
Next to the council street bin by the 244 bus stop, someone has dumped what looks like a padded bed head and some framework like a large clothes air-er. It could not possibly fit in the bin and is an eyesore. It has been left on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shrewsbury Lane, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing and abandoned litter bin in front of 55 Shooters Hill, 1st October
item.description:
This bin has been left in front of 55 Shooters Hill for over 2 weeks. The bin doesn't belong to no. 55 Shooters Hill and has also not been emptied by the bin collections either. It looks like the problem was already reported 2 weeks ago, and it says fixed but nothing has actually been done. Please can this bin be taken away.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Shooters Hill, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Climsland House. A resident has fly tipped. Been here 3 weeks, 1st October
item.description:
Emailed Emmanuel at the council repeatedly. Rubbish has been here for over 3 weeks. Needs removal. Dara- number 7. Reporting again, but hopefully through a method that finally gets attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duchy Street, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is water coming out, 1st October
item.description:
There seems to be water there, which has been a while that’s it’s been like this, causing a puddle. Not sure if it’s blocked drain however even when it hasn’t rained for a few days it’s still soppy and wet ect.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, London

item.title: Poorly lit street, 1st October
item.description:
There are simply too few lights on Cabbell Street, making it dangerous after sunset. The ones there currently are too dim, and there are too few of them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Cabbell Street, Paddington, London

item.title: Large amount of rubbish daily outside 96 Belgrave Road, 1st October
item.description:
I have written to council about this now. It is not being collected for some reason. I am reporting here to remove this rubbish as it sometimes sits for over 24 hours outside our building. Almost daily issue!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Belgrave Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electric box with dangerous wires exposed, 1st October
item.description:
Wide open box with lots of wires hanging out. Unsafe for kids (I have 7yo twins). Outside 35 Avondale Road at corner of Abingdon. Needs fixing and shutting. I moved in on 23rd July and it’s been like that since. Please come close the box.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avondale Road, Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
